text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Place the walnut halves into a saucepan of boiling water. Boil for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Drain the water and catch the walnuts in a colander or sieve. Arrange the boiled walnuts on a baking dish or sheet covered by parchment paper. Place in the oven to bake for 15–30 minutes, or until they start turning brown. It is important to keep an eye on the baking process. Prepare the curry mixture while the walnuts are baking. In a small bowl, mix the curry powder and salt together. Remove from the oven. Toss the walnuts in a bowl with a little butter. Alternately, brush each one with melted butter, using a pastry brush. Sprinkle each walnut with the curry salt mixture.  Place the coated walnuts on absorbent kitchen paper towel. Leave to cool. Finished.
